page.title: 10WOODINGDEAN'S SCHOOL CHANGES
page.content: There are three main school sites in Woodingdean.At present all three cater for pupils under 12 in a series of first and middle schools.The system was introduced to the Brighton area in 1972 the year before East Sussex Education Authority took control. Previously there had been Infant and Junior (5-11).In 1985 this system is to be reintroduced.The present Woodingdean Middle School was built as a Primary School in the early 1950's.It is a one-story brick building set in large playing fields. During 1984-5 major alterations have been made involving pupils and staff in constant change.At the end of the school year half the school population will enter Secondary School.At the beginning of September 1985 Woodingdean Primary School will replace Woodingdean Middle School.
